data.name: Muhammad Mustafa 'Abd al-Fatah Radwan
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers in the building where he barricaded himself along with three other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, who were also killed. Shortly beforehand, the four men participated in clashes that broke out after the soldiers entered the town, during which Palestinians shot and threw explosives. During the clashes, one of the soldiers was injured. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Walid Isma'il Walid Radwan
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers in the building where he barricaded himself along with three other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, who were also killed. Shortly beforehand, the four men participated in clashes that broke out after the soldiers entered the town, during which Palestinians shot and threw explosives. During the clashes, one of the soldiers was injured. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Qusai Jamal Salim Salah
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers in the building where he barricaded himself along with three other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, who were also killed. Shortly beforehand, the four men participated in clashes that broke out after the soldiers entered the town, during which Palestinians shot and threw explosives. During the clashes, one of the soldiers was injured. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Iyad Ahmad Mustafa Shbeitah
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers in the building where he barricaded himself along with three other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, who were also killed. Shortly beforehand, the four men participated in clashes that broke out after the soldiers entered the town, during which Palestinians shot and threw explosives. During the clashes, one of the soldiers was injured. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Usayed Jawad Matar Bani 'Odeh
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers while standing on his rooftop during clashes that broke out when a military force entered the town and arrested a Palestinian. Palestinians fired and threw explosive devices and stones at soldiers during the clashes. According to the military, Bani ‘Odeh participated in shooting aimed at the soldiers.

data.name: Usayed Tareq Anis Rimawi
data.notes: Wounded in the abdomen by soldiers’ gunfire while trying to evacuate a wounded man together with another young man, who was also wounded. Died of his wounds shortly after. Security camera footage shows Rimawi and other youths being shot by soldiers in ambush while standing on the road. Two other young men were wounded by gunfire while trying to escape. About 90 minutes before the ambush shooting, village residents threw stones and Molotov cocktails at military jeeps and set tires on fire throughout the village.

data.name: Lara Emil Ya'qub Tanus
data.notes: Injured by Palestinians’ gunfire while riding in a car on Route 60, near the intersection with Route 465. A Palestinian who was riding in the car in front of her was also killed in the shooting.

data.name: 'Ammar Mustafa 'Abd al-Fatah Mansur
data.notes: Fatally shot by Palestinians while riding in his car on Route 60, near the intersection with Route 465. A Palestinian citizen of Israel who was riding in the car behind him was also injured by the gunfire and died of her wounds on 25 January 2024.

data.name: Ahmad Mahmoud Hussein Muhareb
data.notes: Wounded in the abdomen by Israeli forces’ fire, while standing next to youths who had placed obstacles at the entrance to the village. Shortly before, Palestinians threw stones and fired at Israeli forces who entered the village following the shooting of two Palestinians on Route 60. Died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Shai Garmai
data.notes: Killed when the military jeep she was riding in hit a roadside bomb when it entered the camp as part of a contingent of military and Border Police forces. Three other Border Police officers were injured in the explosion. During the clashes that broke out after Israeli forces entered, Palestinians fired and threw improvised explosive devices, Molotov cocktails and stones at them. A missile fired from an aircraft at a group of Palestinians, some of whom threw explosives and Molotov cocktails, killed six of them on scene and injured a minor who died of his wounds later.

data.name: Haza' Najeh Hassan Darwish
data.notes: Killed together with five other Palestinians by a missile fired from an aircraft while they participated in clashes that included stone, improvised explosive device and Molotov cocktail throwing as well as shooting at military and Border Police vehicles that entered the camp. A minor who was injured by the missile strike died of his wounds shortly after. During the clashes, a Border Police officer was killed by an explosive device and three others were injured.

data.name: Ahmad Najeh Hassan Darwish
data.notes: Killed together with five other Palestinians by a missile fired from an aircraft while they participated in clashes that included stone, improvised explosive device and Molotov cocktail throwing as well as shooting at military and Border Police vehicles that entered the camp. A minor who was injured by the missile strike died of his wounds shortly after. During the clashes, a Border Police officer was killed by an explosive device and three others were injured.

data.name: Rami Najeh Hassan Darwish
data.notes: Killed together with five other Palestinians by a missile fired from an aircraft while they participated in clashes that included stone, improvised explosive device and Molotov cocktail throwing as well as shooting at military and Border Police vehicles that entered the camp. A minor who was injured by the missile strike died of his wounds shortly after. During the clashes, a Border Police officer was killed by an explosive device and three others were injured.

data.name: 'Alaa a-Din Najeh Hassan Darwish
data.notes: Killed together with five other Palestinians by a missile fired from an aircraft while they participated in clashes that included stone, improvised explosive device and Molotov cocktail throwing as well as shooting at military and Border Police vehicles that entered the camp. A minor who was injured by the missile strike died of his wounds shortly after. During the clashes, a Border Police officer was killed by an explosive device and three others were injured.

data.name: Rizqallah Nabil Suliman 'As'us
data.notes: Killed together with five other Palestinians by a missile fired from an aircraft while they participated in clashes that included stone, improvised explosive device and Molotov cocktail throwing as well as shooting at military and Border Police vehicles that entered the camp. A minor who was injured by the missile strike died of his wounds shortly after. During the clashes, a Border Police officer was killed by an explosive device and three others were injured.

data.name: Muhammad Yasser Hassan 'As'us
data.notes: Killed together with five other Palestinians by a missile fired from an aircraft while they participated in clashes that included stone, improvised explosive device and Molotov cocktail throwing as well as shooting at military and Border Police vehicles that entered the camp. His brother, a minor, was wounded by the missile strike and died of his wounds shortly after. During the clashes, a Border Police officer was killed by an explosive device and three others were injured.

data.name: Wadi' Yasser Hassan 'As'us
data.notes: Injured by a missile fired from an aircraft while participating in clashes that included stone, improvised explosive device and Molotov cocktail throwing as well as shooting at military and Border Police vehicles that entered the camp. Died of his wounds shortly after. Six other Palestinians were killed on scene by the missile strike, including his brother. During the clashes, a Border Police officer was killed by an explosive device and three others were injured.

data.name: Ruqayah Ahmad 'Odeh Jahalin
data.notes: Wounded by Border Police officers’ gunfire at a checkpoint while riding in a shared taxi with her mother and siblings. The officers fired at a couple who broke through the checkpoint in their car and ran over a female officer, who was lightly injured. The couple were killed on scene. Israel held her body until 16 January 2024.

data.name: Muhammad Mazyad Mustafa Abu 'Eid
data.notes: Fatally shot along with his wife by Border Police officers, after breaking through a checkpoint in their car and running over a police officer, lightly injuring her. A four-year-old girl who arrived at the checkpoint in a shared taxi with her mother and three siblings was also killed by the officers’ gunfire. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Duha Nabih 'Abd a-Rahman Abu 'Eid
data.notes: Fatally shot along with her husband by Border Police officers, after the husband broke through a checkpoint in their car and ran over a police officer, lightly injuring her. A four-year-old girl who arrived at the checkpoint in a shared taxi with her mother and three siblings was also killed by the officers’ gunfire. Israel held her body until 29 February 2024.

data.name: Yusef 'Ali Hassan Khuli
data.notes: Fatally shot along with two other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives by soldiers and undercover Border Police officers who surrounded a house they were in with other Palestinians. The three were trying to flee the area when they were shot. After they were shot, a security camera recorded a military jeep running over the body of one of the operatives. During their raid on the village, the Israeli forces arrested two Palestinians.

data.name: 'Ahed Suliman Salem Abu Musa
data.notes: Fatally shot along with two other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives by soldiers and undercover Border Police officers who surrounded a house they were in with other Palestinians. The three were trying to flee the area when they were shot. After they were shot, a security camera recorded a military jeep running over the body of one of the operatives. During their raid on the village, the Israeli forces arrested two Palestinians.

data.name: Tareq Amjad Khaled Shahin
data.notes: Fatally shot along with two other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives by soldiers and undercover Border Police officers who surrounded a house they were in with other Palestinians. The three were trying to flee the area when they were shot. After he was shot, a security camera recorded a military jeep running over his body. During their raid on the village, the Israeli forces arrested two Palestinians.

data.name: Fahim Ahmad Fahim al-Khatib
data.notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire while trying to escape from them after he and other youths threw stones at jeeps transporting Israeli military forces that entered the city and arrested Palestinians. After he was injured, soldiers stood next to him for several minutes, preventing access to him.

data.name: 'Amid Ibrahim Samih al-Jayusi
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after, according to the military, attempting to stab them at the checkpoint. According to the family, al-Jayusi suffered from a psychosocial disorder. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Isma'il Ahmad Yusef Abu Jheishah
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with his two cousins, both minors, after they entered the settlement and, according to the military, fired at soldiers patrolling there, causing light to moderate injuries to one of them. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Mahmoud 'Arafat Yusef Abu Jheishah
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with his two cousins, one of whom was also a minor, after they entered the settlement and, according to the military, fired at soldiers patrolling there, causing light to moderate injuries to one of them. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: 'Udai Isma'il Yusef Abu Jheishah
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with his two cousins, one of whom was also a minor, after they entered the settlement and, according to the military, fired at soldiers patrolling there, causing light to moderate injuries to one of them. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Khaled Ahmad Muhammad Zbeidi
data.notes: Wounded in the back by soldiers’ gunfire from about 50 meters away, while running away, together with other youths, from clashes that developed after the soldiers entered the village. During the clashes, Palestinians threw stones at the soldiers. Two other Palestinians were injured in the shooting. After Zbeidi was injured, the soldiers dragged him to the side of the road.

data.name: Yamen Ahmad Musa 'Asfur
data.notes: Wounded by soldiers after throwing IEDs at them during clashes that developed after they entered the town. The soldiers arrested a Palestinian during the raid. ‘Asfur was taken to a hospital in Jenin where he was hospitalized until his death.

data.name: Suliman Muhammad Suliman Kan'an
data.notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire when he tried to get out of a car to evacuate his friend who was fatally shot by soldiers in ambush after throwing an improvised explosive device at a military base. Died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Khaled 'Amer Khaled Hmeidat
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers in ambush, after getting out of a car near a military base and throwing an improvised explosive device at the base. His friend, a minor, who remained in the car, tried to get out to evacuate him. He was shot and taken to hospital, where he died of his wounds shortly after. Two ambulances arrived at the scene but soldiers prevented their teams from evacuating Hmeidat and fired at them, smashing a light in one of the ambulances. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Ahmad Musa Muhammad al-Jabarin
data.notes: Fatally shot along with his cousin by soldiers pursuing the car they were in. According to the military, the pair broke through a checkpoint near Sa’ir, and fired at the soldiers during the pursuit. A rifle, ammunition and an ax were found in their car. According to their family, they went hunting with a shotgun. The soldiers delayed their evacuation for several hours.

data.name: Jalal 'Issa Muhammad al-Jabarin
data.notes: Fatally shot along with his cousin by soldiers pursuing the car they were in. According to the military, the pair broke through a checkpoint near Sa’ir, and fired at the soldiers during the pursuit. A rifle, ammunition and an ax were found in their car. According to their family, they went hunting with a shotgun. The soldiers delayed their evacuation for several hours.

data.name: Luai Majed Salim a-Sufi
data.notes: Resident of Jordan. Shot in the chest by soldiers while on the street in an area where clashes broke out. A-Sufi did not participate in the clashes. During the clashes, youths threw stones at soldiers who had entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. A-Sufi was visiting relatives in the camp with his mother.

data.name: Edna Bloshtein
data.notes: Injured by a car in an incident involving two Palestinians who stole cars, ran over passersby and stabbed them. Eighteen other Israeli civilians were injured in the incident. Died of her wounds shortly after.

data.name: Fares Mahmoud 'Abdallah Khalifah
data.notes: An officer with the Palestinian Authority Preventative Security Agency. Fatally shot by soldiers while crossing a checkpoint in his car. According to the military, the soldiers tried to stop him, but Khalifah tried to escape and was shot. Khalifah was an al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative.

data.name: Muhammad Hassan Ibrahim Darawish
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers while on the street near Palestinians who were throwing stones at them as military and Border Police forces were retreating from the town after arresting Palestinians. During the Israeli forces’ incursion into the town, clashes broke out in several areas, in which Palestinians threw stones and Molotov cocktails at the Israeli forces. The Israeli forces’ fire killed one woman on her rooftop and injured at least 10 other Palestinians. The forces used a town resident as a human shield.

data.name: 'Ahd Mahmoud Yusef Awlad Muhammad
data.notes: Shot in the head by soldiers while standing on her rooftop, calling out to her husband, who was in the street while Palestinians threw stones and Molotov cocktails at soldiers and Border Police officers in clashes that developed after the Israeli forces entered the town and arrested Palestinians. During the clashes, another Palestinian was killed and at least 10 were wounded by the forces’ fire. The forces also used a town resident as a human shield.

data.name: 'Abdallah Sa'id 'Ali Shalal
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft with four other armed Palestinians, including two other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, while traveling in a car. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Mahmoud Yusef Muhammad Abu Hamdan
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft with four other armed Palestinians, including two other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, while traveling in a car. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Seif 'Ali Mahmoud a-Najmi
data.notes: Killed with four other armed Palestinians, including his brother and three al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, when a missile fired from an aircraft struck the car in which they were traveling. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Yazan 'Ali Mahmoud a-Najmi
data.notes: Killed with four other armed Palestinians, including his brother and three al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, when a missile fired from an aircraft struck the car in which they were traveling. Israel is holding parts of his body.

data.name: Muhammad Jum'ah Muhammad Qatawi
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft with four other armed Palestinians, including two other al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, while traveling in a car. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Ashraf Ahmad Yasin Yasin
data.notes: Fatally shot by Israeli forces while riding in a car near an area where clashes developed after soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed seven others in the city and the refugee camp. Four of the dead, including three minors, were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft. A Hamas military wing operative was also killed in a fire exchange and two Palestinians were killed in clashes that developed following the raid, during which Palestinians threw explosive devices and fired at the Israeli forces. One of the two had thrown an explosive device at the Israeli forces and the other stood on a rooftop, watching the clashes. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

data.name: Muhammad Muti' Mahmoud Salit
data.notes: Fatally shot by Israeli forces during clashes, in which he participated from a rooftop, that developed after soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed seven others in the city and the refugee camp. Four of the dead, including three minors, were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft. Three other Palestinians were killed during the clashes; one had thrown an explosive device at the Israeli forces; another drove through the area where the clashes were taking place and the third was standing on a rooftop watching the clashes. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

data.name: Ahmad Mu'in Dib Mahdawi
data.notes: Killed along with three other Palestinians, all minors, by a missile fired from an aircraft when they were near armed Palestinians who fired and threw explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed four others in the city and the refugee camp, including a Hamas military wing operative, who was shot during a fire exchange, a Palestinian who was standing on his rooftop watching the clashes that developed following the raid, a Palestinian who threw an explosive device during the clashes, and a Palestinian who drove through the area where the clashes were taking place. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

data.name: Ahmad Musa Mutlaq al-Bidu
data.notes: Killed along with three other Palestinians, including two other minors, by a missile fired from an aircraft when they were near armed Palestinians who fired and threw explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed four others in the city and the refugee camp, including a Hamas military wing operative, who was shot during a fire exchange, a Palestinian who was standing on his rooftop watching the clashes that developed following the raid, a Palestinian who threw an explosive device during the clashes, and a Palestinian who drove through the area where the clashes were taking place. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

data.name: Ahmad Tareq Nu'man Faraj
data.notes: Killed along with three other Palestinians, including two other minors, by a missile fired from an aircraft when they were near armed Palestinians who fired and threw explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed four others in the city and the refugee camp, including a Hamas military wing operative, who was shot during a fire exchange, a Palestinian who was standing on his rooftop watching the clashes that developed following the raid, a Palestinian who threw an explosive device during the clashes, and a Palestinian who drove through the area where the clashes were taking place. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

data.name: Walid Ibrahim Muhammad Ghanem
data.notes: Killed along with three other Palestinians, including two other minors, by a missile fired from an aircraft when they were near armed Palestinians who fired and threw explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed four others in the city and the refugee camp, including a Hamas military wing operative, who was shot during a fire exchange, a Palestinian who was standing on his rooftop watching the clashes that developed following the raid, a Palestinian who threw an explosive device during the clashes, and a Palestinian who drove through the area where the clashes were taking place. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

data.name: Muhammad Feisal Dawas Abu 'Awwad
data.notes: Fatally shot by Israeli forces while standing on a rooftop, watching clashes that developed after soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed seven others in the city and the refugee camp. Four of the dead, including three minors, were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft. A Hamas military wing operative was also killed in a fire exchange and two Palestinians were killed in clashes that developed following the raid, during which Palestinians threw explosive devices and fired at the Israeli forces. One of the two had thrown an explosive device at the Israeli forces and the other drove through the area where the clashes were taking place. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

data.name: 'Abd a-Rahman 'Issam Ibrahim 'Othman
data.notes: Fatally shot by Israeli forces after a short chase on foot that followed him throwing an explosive device at them, during clashes that developed after the Israeli forces raided the city of Tulkarm and the refugee camp. Palestinians fired at Israeli forces during the clashes. The forces chased ‘Othman to the entrance of a house and shot him there. His body was found with his feet tied. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed seven others in the city and the refugee camp. Four of the dead, including three minors, were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft. A Hamas military wing operative was also killed in a fire exchange and two Palestinians were killed in the clashes. One of the two was standing on a rooftop watching the clashes, and the other drove through the area where the clashes were taking place. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

data.name: Tawfiq Hafez 'Abd al-Jabbar 'Ijaq
data.notes: Shot in the head by an off-duty Israel Police officer and an Israeli citizen while riding in his car with his friend, a minor, on his family's land near the village. According to the military, the shooting, carried out in the presence of a soldier, was prompted by suspicions that the minors threw stones at Route 60. B’Tselem’s investigation reveals that the two were shot as they were about to head back after an excursion on land owned by ‘Ajaq’s family and did not pose a threat to anyone. After the shooting, two military jeeps arrived at the scene, and then more shots were fired at ‘Ajaq’s car.

data.name: Muhammad Khalil Muhammad Kharmah
data.notes: Wounded by Israeli forces’ gunfire when he and several other Palestinians stood behind a dumpster, watching, from about 70 meters away, the movements of an armed forces contingent that went into the home of a detainee from the village and confiscated a car. B’Tselem’s research revealed that when the forces first arrived at the village, a handful of stones were thrown at them, but no clashes were underway at the time Kharmah was shot. After Kharmah was injured, some youths threw stones at the armed forces and set dumpsters on fire.

data.name: Yamen Muhammad Mustafa As'ad Lahluh
data.notes: Shot in the abdomen by soldiers when throwing stones at them during clashes in which other Palestinians threw improvised explosive devices at the soldiers.

data.name: Karim Nashaat Kamal 'Ayesh
data.notes: Shot in the head and upper body by soldiers, after, according to the soldiers, riding up to the checkpoint on a scooter and firing at them. ‘Ayesh was a Hamas military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Wisam Walid Muhammad Khashan
data.notes: Shot all over his body while at home with members of his family by undercover Border Police officers who surrounded the house and arrested his brother. Khashan was a Hamas military wing operative.

data.name: Qassam Ahmad 'Abd al-Karim Yasin
data.notes: Wounded in the abdomen by Israeli forces’ gunfire while participating in a fire exchange that broke out after they entered the camp. Yasin was an al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operative.

data.name: Muhannad Isma'il Muhsen Fasfus
data.notes: Wounded by Israeli forces’ gunfire while participating in clashes that lasted several hours and during which youths threw stones at Israeli forces that entered the town, raided homes and played soccer in the field. Died of his wounds shortly after. Four more Palestinians were wounded by the Israeli forces’ gunfire. One of them died of his wounds later that day.

data.name: Mu'taz Mahmoud Muhammad Tbeish
data.notes: Injured in the head while chasing military jeeps that were retreating from the town after Israeli forces raided it, entered homes and played soccer in the field. Died of his wounds shortly after. In clashes that developed after the soldiers entered, Palestinians threw stones at the soldiers, who fired and wounded four of them. One of the wounded died of his wounds that day.

data.name: Wasim Abu al-Heija
data.notes: Palestinian citizen of Israel. Fatally shot by soldiers after he ran over one of them, seriously injuring him, collided with the wall of a military base, got out of the car and, according to the military, tried to attack passersby with an ax. Israel held his body until 16 April 2024.

data.name: Thaer Na'im Mahmoud Hamu
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers who had entered the town and arrested Palestinians, while walking down the street. Security camera footage shows Hamu walking down the street, not carrying a weapon, and then running, sustaining a gunshot wound and falling to the ground. During clashes that broke out in the town, Palestinians threw stones and improvised explosive devices and fired at the soldiers. According to the military, the soldiers fired at Hamu after he fired at soldiers who tried to stop him.

data.name: Rani Yasser Khalaf a-Sha'er
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers who claimed he had approached a military post holding a knife. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: 'Abd a-Rahman 'Abd a-Rahim Suliman Hamed
data.notes: Fatally shot by a police officer from a jeep, from about 100 meters away, while walking home from school. Hamed was shot on the street, near the hiding spot of some youths who, shortly before, threw stones at Israel Police, Border Police and military forces that entered the city. The Israeli forces were roaming the streets of the town, shouting provocations on a loudspeaker, stopping residents and passersby and firing tear gas. The police claimed Hamed threw a Molotov cocktail at the Israeli forces.

data.name: Basel Ayman 'Awni Ghazawi
data.notes: Fatally shot with his brother and their friend, by Special Police Unit and Shin Bet personnel in his room at Ibn Sina Hospital, where he was hospitalized after being injured by fragments from an Israeli missile on 25 October 2023. Both brothers were Islamic Jihad military wing operatives and the friend was a Hamas military wing operative. The Israeli personnel, who entered the hospital disguised as medical staff and Palestinian visitors, attacked some of the staff on their way in.

data.name: Muhammad Ayman 'Awni Ghazawi
data.notes: Fatally shot with his brother and their friend, by Special Police Unit and Shin Bet personnel in a room at Ibn Sina Hospital, where the brother, also an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, was hospitalized after being injured by fragments from an Israeli missile on 25 October 2023. The friend was a Hamas military wing operative. The Israeli personnel, who entered the hospital disguised as medical staff and Palestinian visitors, attacked some of the staff on their way in.

data.name: Muhammad Walid 'Aref Jalamneh
data.notes: Fatally shot with two brothers, both Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, by Special Police Unit and Shin Bet personnel in a room at Ibn Sina Hospital, where one of the brothers was hospitalized after being injured by fragments from an Israeli missile on 25 October 2023. The Israeli personnel, who entered the hospital disguised as medical staff and Palestinian visitors, attacked some of the staff on their way in. Jalamneh was a Hamas military wing operative.

data.name: Wadi' Shadi Sa'ed 'Alian
data.notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers while fleeing them after attempting to stab one of them when the two officers were standing on the road next to their vehicle. Security camera footage shows the officers firing at ‘Alian as he lies wounded on the ground. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Mahmoud So'ud 'Abdallah a-Titi
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at a checkpoint after, according to the army, having advanced towards them carrying weapons. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Mu'tasem 'Ali Muhammad Hussein 'Ali
data.notes: Killed while barricaded in his house during a fire exchange with soldiers and Border Police officers. A bulldozer destroyed parts of the building, and then the Israeli forces fired anti-tank missiles at it. During a fire exchange in the home’s yard, two other Palestinians, both al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operatives, were also killed. One was ‘Ali’s cousin and the other was also an officer with the Palestinian Authority security forces. According to the military, they were shot while trying to escape. According to the Palestinian Red Crescent Society, nine others were wounded by the Israeli forces’ fire. Israel is holding the body of Hussein ‘Ali, who was a senior al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operative.

data.name: Islam Ibrahim Muhammad Hussein 'Ali
data.notes: Shot by soldiers and Border Police undercover officers, who fired at him, along with another al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative, who was also an officer with the Palestinian Authority security forces, during a fire exchange with the Israeli forces in the yard of a building where his cousin, a senior operative in the Brigade, who was also killed, was barricaded. According to the military, the two were shot while trying to escape. According to the Palestinian Red Crescent Society, nine others were wounded by the Israeli forces’ fire.

data.name: Ziad 'Ali Hashem D'amah
data.notes: An officer with the Palestinian Authority security forces. Shot by soldiers and Border Police undercover officers, who fired at him, along with another al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative, during a fire exchange with the Israeli forces in the yard of a building where a senior operative in the Brigade, who was also killed, was barricaded. According to the military, the two were shot while trying to escape. According to the Palestinian Red Crescent Society, nine others were wounded by the Israeli forces’ fire.

data.name: al-Mansur bi-Allah Jalal Mahmoud al-Jabar
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at a checkpoint after, according to the military, firing at them and hitting the helmet of one. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Mu'az Ashraf Fateh Bani Shamsah
data.notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire while throwing stones at them along with other youths after the soldiers entered the town. While in the town, the soldiers shot and wounded two other youths and arrested two others. Died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Muhammad Ahmad Muhammad Khaddur
data.notes: Shot in the head by Israeli armed forces who were on the other side of the separation fence while driving home with a friend who is a minor from a hike in woods located about 100-150 meters from the separation barrier. The friend fled on foot to a nearby village and returned to the car with some youths who helped him take al-Khaddur to an ambulance that was waiting for them. He was pronounced dead at the hospital.

data.name: Rami Rashed Muhammad Bataha
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers while on his way home, located 50 meters away. The military claims he was shot after trying to stab one of the soldiers. An eyewitness told B’Tselem Bataha was shot after an argument between him and the soldiers.

data.name: Muhammad Tareq Salim Abu Sneineh
data.notes: Wounded by Border Police officers’ fire after, according to the police, trying to stab them on al-Wad (HaGuy) Street. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Muhammad Sharif Hassan Silmi
data.notes: Fatally shot by Israeli armed forces while driving in his car during a raid of the camp by military, Border Police and Shin Bet forces, during which they arrested seven Palestinians. According to the military, Silmi tried to run over security personnel who were in the street.

data.name: Nayhal Ziad Muhammad Breighith
data.notes: Wounded in the head by shots fired by soldiers and Border Police officers who entered the town when school let out and students threw stones at the Israeli forces. Died of his wounds shortly after. According to media reports, 18 more Palestinians were wounded by the Israeli forces' fire, at least nine of them minors. 11 were wounded by live fire and seven by rubber coated metal bullets.

data.name: Ori Yaish
data.notes: Fatally shot along with an Israeli citizen by an armed Palestinian who opened fire at Israelis in Reem (Masmiya) Junction. The shooter was fatally shot by a soldier. According to media reports, four other Israelis were wounded in the shooting, one critically and another severely.

data.name: Yishai Gartner
data.notes: Fatally shot along with an Israeli soldier by an armed Palestinian who opened fire at Israelis in Reem (Masmiya) Junction. The shooter was fatally shot by a soldier. According to media reports, four other Israelis were wounded in the shooting, one critically and another severely.

data.name: Fadi Ahmad Rushdi Jamjum
data.notes: Fatally shot by a soldier after opening fire at Israelis at Reem (Masmiya) Junction, killing a civilian and a soldier and wounding four other Israelis, who according to the media, sustained critical or severe injuries. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Muhammad Ahmad Fayez al-'Ofi
data.notes: Fatally shot during a fire exchange with soldiers and Border Police officers who surrounded the house where he was barricaded. Clashes broke out following the Israeli forces’ incursion into the camp, during which Palestinians fired at them. Al-’Ofi was an al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative. Another Palestinian was shot while standing on his rooftop in the camp. Israel is holding al-’Ofi’s body. According to the police, an undercover Border Police officer was severely injured in the shooting.

data.name: Nabil 'Ata Muhammad 'Amer
data.notes: Wounded in the back of the head by Israeli forces’ gunfire while standing on the roof of his family’s building together with several siblings and cousins, as the forces entered the camp and surrounded another home, where an al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative was barricaded. The Israeli forces killed the operative during a fire exchange. ‘Amer’s family members carried him to an ambulance that was waiting 200 meters away from the building because the driver was afraid to get closer due to the Israeli forces’ actions.

data.name: Anas Jamil Ahmad Dweikat
data.notes: Member of the Palestinian Authority security forces. Shot by soldiers when he drove up to the Beit Furik checkpoint, according to the military, after failing to heed the soldiers’ calls. According to his family, Dweikat suffered from a psychosocial disability.

data.name: 'Aref Marwan 'Aref 'Ali
data.notes: Fatally shot during a fire exchange with soldiers and Border Police officers who entered the camp. During the clashes that developed after they entered, Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at the Israeli forces. 14 Palestinians were arrested during the raid. ‘Ali was an al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative.

data.name: Fadi Sa'id Kamal Suliman
data.notes: Shot in the shoulder by soldiers while on the street throwing stones at them from a rooftop. The soldiers entered the town after some youths threw an improvised explosive device at Route 55. After the shooting, the soldiers prevented his evacuation for at least half an hour. Died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Matan Elmaliah
data.notes: Fatally shot near a-Za’ayem Checkpoint by three armed Palestinians who came out of two cars and opened fire at Israeli passengers. Eight other Israelis were wounded by the gunfire. Two of the shooters were fatally shot by Israeli officers and civilians and the third was wounded and arrested.

data.name: Muhammad al-Hakim 'Issa 'Ali Zawahrah
data.notes: Fatally shot with another Palestinian by Israeli civilians and police officers. The two were shot after firing at Israeli passengers near a-Za’ayem Checkpoint, killing one and wounding eight. His brother, who took part in the shooting, was wounded and arrested. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Ahmad 'Azzam Ahmad al-Wahsh
data.notes: Fatally shot with another Palestinian by Israeli civilians and police officers. The two were shot after firing at Israeli passengers near a-Za’ayem Checkpoint, killing one and wounding eight. Another shooter was wounded and arrested. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Yasser Mustafa 'Abd a-Rahman Hanun
data.notes: killed by a missile fired from an aircraft while traveling by car in the center of the camp. 17 other Palestinians who were on the street were wounded by the gunfire, including a minor who died of his wounds soon after and an Islamic Jihad military wing operative who died of his wounds on 26 February 2024. Hanun was a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

data.name: Sa'id Raed Muhammad Jaradat
data.notes: Wounded on the street by a missile fired from an aircraft at a car in which a senior Islamic Jihad operative was traveling. The operative died on the spot. 16 other Palestinians were wounded by the gunfire, including an Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Died of his wounds on 26 February 2024.

data.name: Majed 'Awad 'Atiyyah Nabahnah
data.notes: Wounded on the street by a missile fired from an aircraft at a car in which a senior Islamic Jihad operative was traveling. The operative died on the spot. 16 other Palestinians were wounded by the gunfire, including a minor who died of his wounds soon after. Nabahnah was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

data.name: Nizar Muhammad 'Abd al-Mu'ti Hasasnah
data.notes: Shot in the chest by Border Police officers’ gunfire while climbing the separation fence between his town and the Zur Baher neighborhood of East Jerusalem with his brother. Died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Ahmad Jamal Ahmad Daraghmeh
data.notes: Shot in the head, chest, shoulder and leg by soldiers while participating, along with other Palestinians, in a fire exchange with soldiers who entered the city with Shin Bet personnel. During the raid, two more Palestinians were killed by the Israeli forces’ fire in the nearby al-Far’ah R.C. One was killed while throwing an explosive device and the other while standing by his window. The military claimed he participated in the clashes. Daraghmeh was a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative. According to media reports, three more Palestinians were injured by the Israeli forces’ fire in the city and a soldier was lightly wounded.

data.name: Ousamah Jaber Mustafa Jaber
data.notes: Shot in the chest by Israeli forces while throwing an improvised explosive device at them during clashes that developed after military and Shin Bet forces entered the camp. His cousin, who was standing at his window was also killed by the Israeli forces’ fire. The military claimed he participated in the clashes. A senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative was killed during a fire exchange with soldiers in the nearby city of Tubas. According to media reports, three more Palestinians were injured by the Israeli forces’ fire in the city and a soldier was lightly wounded.

data.name: Muhammad Samih Muhammad Bayadsah
data.notes: Shot in the head by Israeli forces while looking at the street from his window, shortly after his cousin was killed by the Israeli forces while throwing an improvised explosive device at them during clashes that developed after military and Shin Bet forces entered the camp. According to the army, Bayadsah participated in the clashes. Soldiers killed a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative in the nearby city of Tubas during a fire exchange. According to media reports, three more Palestinians were injured by the Israeli forces’ fire in the city and a soldier was lightly wounded.

data.name: Muhammad Yusef Diab Manasrah
data.notes: A Palestinian Authority police officer. Fatally shot by a soldier after opening fire at Israeli civilians at a gas station in the settlement and killing two of them. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Yitzhak Zeiger
data.notes: Fatally shot along with an Israeli minor by a Palestinian Authority police officer who opened fire at Israelis at a gas station in the settlement. The shooter was fatally shot by a soldier.

data.name: Salah a-Din Suliman Muhammad Shawamreh
data.notes: Shot in the chest, abdomen and left arm and leg by soldiers in ambush while trying to climb the separation fence to return to the West Bank with his two brothers. The brothers had been picking ‘aqub (gundelia) for several days. His two brothers were also wounded, and one of them died of his wounds soon after. The third brother was detained for several hours and then released. A fourth brother, who remained in Israel and continued picking ‘aqub, tried to return home via Tarqumya Checkpoint after hearing his brothers had been shot. He was detained at the checkpoint and sent to administrative detention.

data.name: Najm a-Din Suliman Muhammad Shawamreh
data.notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers in ambush while trying to climb the separation fence to return to the West Bank with his two brothers. The brothers had been picking ‘aqub (gundelia) for several days. His two brothers were also wounded, and one of them died of his wounds soon after. The third brother was detained for several hours and then released. A fourth brother, who remained in Israel and continued picking ‘aqub, tried to return home via Tarqumya Checkpoint after hearing his brothers had been shot. He was detained at the checkpoint and sent to administrative detention.

data.name: Bashar Nihad 'Abd a-Latif Hanani
data.notes: Wounded by Israeli soldiers’ gunfire while throwing stones at them along with other youths as the soldiers were entering the village.

data.name: Nur a-Din Ibrahim Muhammad Yasin
data.notes: Wounded by Israeli forces’ gunfire while participating in clashes that developed after they entered the camp and arrested a Palestinian. During the clashes, Palestinians threw stones and improvised explosive devices at the Israeli forces and fired at them.

data.name: Oriah Hartum
data.notes: Fatally shot along with another Israeli civilian by a Palestinian Authority police officer who opened fire at Israelis at a gas station in the settlement. The shooter was fatally shot by a soldier.

data.name: Muhammad Murad Hassan Ghneim
data.notes: Wounded in the head by shots fired by soldiers in ambush, while standing and talking to his brother and another minor, on their way home, thinking the military had withdrawn from the village. Earlier, Palestinian youths gathered and some of them threw stones at military jeeps that entered the village and drove around in it. The soldiers prevented Ghneim’s evacuation for several minutes. Died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Muhammad Khaled Taher Zeid
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers from inside the settlement of Beit El. According to a friend who was with him and was injured by fragments, the two were sitting near the fence. According to the military, Zeid was shot after he threw a Molotov cocktail into the area of the settlement. The military held his body for about an hour, and then left it on the ground and notified the Palestinian DCO about its location.

data.name: Mustafa Iyad Yihya Abu Shalbak
data.notes: Wounded by shots fired by Israeli forces during clashes in which Palestinian youths threw stones at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who entered the camp, arrested two Palestinians and interrogated dozens of others. Abu Shalbak died of his wounds shortly after. At least one other Palestinian was injured in the clashes. After Abu Shalbak was wounded, armed Palestinians fired at the Israeli forces, lightly wounding a Border Police officer.

data.name: Muhammad Mahmoud Raja 'Eid
data.notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire on the way home from work. Some youths threw stones at the soldiers, who had entered the village in three jeeps, fired live rounds, and hit a 10-year-old child who was traveling in a car with his father and brother in the head. The soldiers also assaulted three Palestinians, including a minor, and arrested another minor.

data.name: 'Amru Muhammad Ghaleb Najjar
data.notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire, while traveling in a car with his father and younger brother. Some youths threw stones at the soldiers, who entered the village in three military jeeps, and responded with gunfire that hit a-Najar. The soldiers held up the car in which residents tried to take him to get medical treatment, and he died shortly after. During their incursion into the village, the soldiers shot and wounded another youth, who died on 7 March 2024, assaulted three other residents, including a minor, and arrested a minor.

data.name: Muhammad Hisham Shihadah
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers staffing a military post at the intersection, after, according to the military, stabbing one of them and severely wounding him. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Muhammad 'Adel Muhammad Shalabi
data.notes: Wounded by shots fired by soldiers and Border Police officers during about an hour-long fire exchange that broke out after the Israeli forces surrounded his house. The Israeli forces arrested Shalabi after he was wounded and announced his death a short time later. Bani Gharrah was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Muhammad Ja'far Mustafa Jaber
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at a convenience store located near a meet-up site for Palestinian laborers, one of whom was wounded by the soldiers’ fire and died of his wounds shortly after. According to the military, Jaber was heading into Israel carrying an explosive device and was shot after he tried to pull out a gun when the soldiers called him out of the convenience store. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Tawfiq 'Aead Fawaz Hussein
data.notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire aimed at another Palestinian inside a convenience store nearby. According to the military, the soldiers arrived at the scene to arrest the Palestinian in the convenience store, who was allegedly planning to enter Israel with an explosive device, and shot him after he tried to pull out a gun. Hussein died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Zeid Wared Shukri Khalayfah
data.notes: Shot in the side of the body, chest and thigh by Border Police officers, while he and four other Palestinians who had arrived at the Separation Fence near Route 436 by car began unloading Molotov cocktails. All four were wounded by the gunfire, including a minor who died of his wounds soon after. The Border Police officers fired from an ambush, at close range, and from several directions. Khalayfah's body was given to a Palestinian ambulance, and the remaining wounded were detained for several hours before being transferred to Palestinian ambulances at al-Jib Checkpoint (Giv'at Ze’ev).

data.name: 'Abdallah Maamun Hassan 'Assaf
data.notes: Wounded by Border Police officers, while he and four other Palestinians who had arrived at the Separation Fence near Route 436 by car began unloading Molotov cocktails. All four were wounded by the gunfire. One of them was killed instantly. The Border Police officers fired from an ambush, at close range, and from several directions. ‘Assaf and the remaining wounded were detained for several hours before being transferred to Palestinian ambulances at al-Jib Checkpoint (Giv'at Ze’ev). ‘Assaf died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Rami 'Ali Muhammad Hamdan
data.notes: Wounded by Border Police officers’ gunfire while launching fireworks at the military tower at the checkpoint along with other minors. In video footage posted on social media, Hamdan is seen lighting a firework, and then being shot and falling to the ground. Died of his wounds shortly after. Israel held his body until 18 March 2024.

data.name: Mahmoud Ziad 'Abd a-Latif Abu al-Heija
data.notes: Wounded in the head by soldiers’ gunfire, while attempting to flee them into the Khalil a-Salman hospital compound in the city after he and other youths threw stones at military jeeps that were passing by on the way to Jenin R.C., where the Israeli forces arrested Palestinians. One of the youths, a Hamas military wing operative, was wounded and died of his wounds shortly after. Abu al-Heija died of his wounds shortly after as well.

data.name: Rabi' Salim Ahmad Jalamneh
data.notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire, while attempting to flee them into the Khalil a-Salman hospital compound in the city after he and other youths threw stones at military jeeps that were passing by on the way to Jenin R.C., where the Israeli forces arrested Palestinians. One of the youths was wounded and died of his wounds shortly after. Jalamneh, who was a Hamas military wing operative, died of his wounds shortly after as well.

data.name: Mustafa Taleb Ahmad Ahmad
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after, according to the military, arriving at a checkpoint on an electric bicycle, stabbing a soldier and a security guard who, according to the media, were lightly to moderately wounded. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Fadi Abu Ltayef
data.notes: Palestinian citizen of Israel. Fatally shot by a soldier he had stabbed and critically wounded at a coffee shop in Beit Kama junction. The soldier died of his wounds shortly after. Israel is holding Abu Ltayef’s body.

data.name: Ori Moyal
data.notes: Critically wounded by a Palestinian citizen of Israel who stabbed him at a coffee shop in Beit Kama junction. Moyal fatally shot the stabber. Died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Mahmoud 'Abd al-Hafez Yusef Nofal
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers while firing at homes in a Jewish settlement in Hebron City Center from inside the Karantina cemetery. Video footage posted on social media shows Nofal walking in the cemetery holding a rifle, and then being hit by the soldiers’ gunfire. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Fakher Bassem Salim Bani Jaber
data.notes: Fatally shot by one of three soldiers who came to his plot of land, while he was grazing his flock on it, about 100 meters away from his house. The soldiers, one of whom was masked, assaulted Bani Jaber, knocking him to the ground. When he picked up a stone to defend himself, one of them fatally shot him. The military claimed that the soldiers arrived after settlers reported an attack on a Jewish child in the area and that there were clashes at the scene, during which Palestinians threw stones. However, B’Tselem’s investigation shows there were no clashes at the scene.

data.name: Ziad Farhan Diab Hamran
data.notes: Fatally shot by two Shin Bet men after firing at them and wounding them. According to media reports, one was lightly wounded and the other was severely wounded. Israel is holding his body. Hamran was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

data.name: Muhammad 'Ursan Yusef Salamah
data.notes: Wounded by shots fired by members of the Palestinian Authority security forces when families of prisoners and deceased persons crowded near the forces’ headquarters in the city, threw explosive devices at it and fired at it.

data.name: Ahmad Ayman Muhammad Barakat
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, while traveling in a car in the city together with a senior military wing operative. The senior operative was wounded and died the next day. According to the military and the Shin Bet, he fatally shot an Israeli citizen in May 2023.

data.name: Mahmoud Bassam Mahmoud Rahal
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, while traveling in a car in the city together with a senior military wing operative. The senior operative was wounded and died the next day. According to the military and the Shin Bet, one of the operatives fatally shot an Israeli citizen in May 2023.

data.name: Muhammad 'Abdallah Muhammad Fayed
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, while traveling in a car in the city together with a senior military wing operative. The senior operative was wounded and died the next day. According to the military and the Shin Bet, one of the operatives fatally shot an Israeli citizen in May 2023.

data.name: Muhammad Maamun Salim Hawashin
data.notes: Wounded by a missile fired from an aircraft along with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, who were killed on the spot. According to the military and the Shin Bet, one of the operatives fatally shot an Israeli citizen in May 2023. Hawashin was a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

data.name: Ahmad Marwan Muhammad 'Ali Jab'awi
data.notes: Palestinian citizen of Israel. Wounded by Israeli forces’ fire, while participating in a fire exchange. During the fire exchange, Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. A minor who was also an Islamic Jihad military wing operative was also wounded in the fire exchange. Both were pronounced dead shortly after. Two other operatives, including a minor, were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft, after, according to the military, throwing explosive devices.

data.name: 'Abdallah Mahmoud Muhammad Rashid (al-Qaysi)
data.notes: Wounded by Israeli forces’ fire, while participating in a fire exchange. During the fire exchange, Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. Another Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was a Palestinian citizen of Israel, was also wounded in the fire exchange. Both were pronounced dead shortly after. Two other operatives, including a minor, were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft, after, according to the military, throwing explosive devices.

data.name: Iyad Nidal 'Azmi Kanuh
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative, while participating in clashes, during which Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. According to the military, the two had thrown explosive devices. Two other operatives, one of them a minor and the other a Palestinian citizen of Israel, were wounded in the clashes and died shortly after.

data.name: Nidal Maamun 'Ali Abu 'Obeid
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative, a minor, while participating in clashes, during which Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. According to the military, the two had thrown explosive devices. Two other operatives, one of them a minor and the other a Palestinian citizen of Israel, were wounded in the clashes and died shortly after.

data.name: Sameh Muhammad 'Abd a-Rahim Hamed Zaytun
data.notes: Fatally shot by a soldier who claimed Zaitun “looked suspicious.” In a video recording posted on social media, Zaitun can be heard arguing with the soldier, who threatens him as he stands at a bus stop, obeying the soldier’s orders to put his hands up, moments before he is shot at close range.

data.name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Karim Ziad Salhiyah
data.notes: Shot in the head from a distance of about 100 meters by a Border Police officer, while hiding behind a car several minutes after throwing stones at armored military, Border Police and Israel Police vehicles, with other youths. The Israeli forces entered the neighborhoods of Kafr ‘Aqab and Umm a-Sharayet and arrested Palestinians, and the youths threw stones at them as they were leaving. After the stone-throwing stopped, another Border Police jeep arrived and an officer stepped out of it, fired at Salhiyeh, and then at a youth who tried to help him, but missed.

data.name: Ibrahim 'Abd a-Rahim Fares Qatash
data.notes: Wounded by shots fired by undercover Border Police officers, while throwing stones at them along with other youths after the officers entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. Died of his wounds shortly after. Armed men in the vicinity of the stone-throwers engaged in a fire exchange with the undercover officers.

data.name: Ilay David Garfinkel
data.notes: Wounded by shots a Palestinian fired at the minibus he was traveling in. Died of his wounds shortly after. Six other soldiers were wounded by the gunfire. The shooter was killed by a missile fired from an aircraft during a fire exchange between him and the soldiers.

data.name: Mujahed Barakat Taha Mansur Karajah
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft during a fire exchange with soldier after firing at a minibus and wounding seven soldiers, one of whom died of his wounds soon after. Israel is holding Mansur’s body.

data.name: Muhammad Naser Sabti Bani Gharrah
data.notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft together with an officer with the Palestinian Authority security forces, while the two participated in clashes that broke out after soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. During the clashes, Palestinians fired and threw explosive devices at the Israeli forces. An al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative was wounded in the missile strike and died of his wounds shortly after. A Palestinian passerby was wounded by Israeli forces’ fire in the city of Jenin. He also died of his wounds shortly after. Bani Gharrah was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

data.name: Hamzah Husam Muhammad 'Ar'arawi
data.notes: An officer with the Palestinian Authority security forces. Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft together with an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, while the two participated in clashes that broke out after soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. During the clashes, Palestinians fired and threw explosive devices at the Israeli forces. An al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative was wounded in the missile strike and died of his wounds shortly after, and another Palestinian passerby was wounded by Israeli forces’ fire in the city of Jenin. He also died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Walid Luai Walid al-Usta
data.notes: Wounded by a missile fired from an aircraft while participating in clashes that broke out after soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. An officer with the Palestinian Authority security forces and an Islamic Jihad military wing operative were also killed in the missile strike. During the clashes, Palestinians fired and threw explosive devices at the Israeli forces. A Palestinian passerby was wounded by Israeli forces’ fire in the city of Jenin. He also died of his wounds shortly after. Al-Usta, who was an al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative, died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: Ayman Yusef Hassan 'Azuqah
data.notes: Wounded by Israeli forces’ gunfire while walking in the street while clashes were underway in various locations in the city of Jenin and in Jenin R.C.. The clashes broke out after soldiers, Shin Bet personnel and Border Police officers entered the city and arrested Palestinians. During the clashes, Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at the Israeli forces. In security camera footage, ‘Azuqah is seen walking down the street with another person, and then trying to run away, getting injured and falling on the ground. During the clashes in Jenin R.C., two Palestinians were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft - an officer with the Palestinian Authority security forces and an Islamic Jihad military wing operative - and an al-Aqsa Martyrs’ Brigade operative was wounded and died of his wounds shortly after.

data.name: al-Mu'tasem bi-Allah Nabil Subhi Hamamdi
data.notes: Fatally shot by soldiers, while participating in clashes during which Palestinian youths threw stones, improvised explosive devices and Molotov cocktails at soldiers who had entered the town and arrested Palestinians. At least two more Palestinians were wounded by Israeli forces’ gunfire in the clashes. One of them died of his wounds on 2 April 2024.

data.name: Rabi' Feisal Ahmad Zakarneh
data.notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire during clashes in which Palestinian youths threw stones, improvised explosive devices and Molotov cocktails at soldiers who had entered the town and arrested Palestinians. A minor was killed by Israeli forces’ gunfire during the clashes and at least one other Palestinian was wounded.

data.name: Naji Abu Freih
data.notes: Wounded by shots fired by a soldier after stabbing another soldier in the city’s central bus station. According to media reports, another soldier was injured by the fragments from the bullets fired at Abu Freih. The Israel Police released video footage showing members of the armed forces dragging Abu Freih, wounded and handcuffed. He was pronounced dead shortly after. Israel is holding his body.

data.name: Lidor Levy
data.notes: Stabbed by a Palestinian who stabbed and wounded two other Israeli citizens at a shopping mall. The stabber was fatally shot by a police officer.

data.name: Muamen Fayez Mahmoud Ekhlayel
data.notes: Fatally shot by an officer after stabbing three Israelis at a shopping mall. One of the Israelis died of his wounds on 4 April 2024. Israel is holding Masalmeh’s body.
